thread.title: Leto compares Joker to 'giving birth out of my pr--khole'
thread.title_full: Leto compares Joker to 'giving birth out of my pr--khole' - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Leto compares Joker to 'giving birth out of my pr--khole'
text:
Courtesy of Warner Bros. /DC Ent Jared Leto took his Joker preparation to some wacky extremes for ‘Suicide Squad.’ Jared Leto proved to be a very practical Joker.
The Oscar winner revealed just how method he went to play the infamous comic book villain for the upcoming flick, "Suicide Squad" in the latest issue of Empire Magazine .
He would, for example, call actor Jim Parrack, who plays his on-screen henchman, at random hours throughout the day with even more random orders, such as to spray-paint roses black.
"There was definitely a period of...detachment," Leto told the British movie magazine, according to Comicbookmovie.com . "I took a pretty deep dive. But this was a unique opportunity and I couldn't imagine doing it another way. It was fun, playing those psychological games.
"But at the same time it was very painful, like giving birth out of my prickhole."
The fruits of his proverbial labor will be seen in "Suicide Squad" when it hits theaters on Aug. 5, 2016. It chronicles a band of DC Comics' marquee supervillains led by Will Smith's Deathstroke who are forced to perform dangerous secret missions for the government.
Part of Warner Bros' ambitious slate of movies to build a larger cinematic superhero universe to compete with arch-rival Marvel Studios, director David Ayer's film also stars Margot Robbie, Cara Delevingne, Jai Courtney and Joel Kinnaman.
